title: List of Malmö FF players
text:
<a href="Malm%C3%B6%20FF">Malmö Fotbollförening</a>, also known simply as Malmö FF, is a Swedish professional <a href="association%20football">association football</a> club based in <a href="Malm%C3%B6">Malmö</a>. The club is affiliated with <a href="Sk%C3%A5nes%20Fotbollf%C3%B6rbund">Skånes Fotbollförbund</a> (The Scanian Football Association), and plays its home games at <a href="Stadion%20%28Malm%C3%B6%29">Stadion</a>. Formed on 24 February 1910, Malmö FF is the most successful club in Sweden in terms of trophies won. The club have won the most <a href="Allsvenskan">league</a> titles of any Swedish club with twenty-one, a joint record eighteen <a href="List%20of%20Swedish%20football%20champions">Swedish championship</a> titles and a record fourteen <a href="Svenska%20Cupen">national cup</a> titles. The team competes in Allsvenskan as of the <a href="2015%20Allsvenskan">2015 season</a>; this is Malmö FF's 15th consecutive season in the top flight, and their 80th overall. The main rivals of the club are <a href="Helsingborgs%20IF%E2%80%93Malm%C3%B6%20FF%20rivalry">Helsingborgs IF</a>, <a href="IFK%20G%C3%B6teborg%E2%80%93Malm%C3%B6%20FF%20rivalry">IFK Göteborg</a> and, historically, <a href="IFK%20Malm%C3%B6%E2%80%93Malm%C3%B6%20FF%20rivalry">IFK Malmö</a>. Since playing their first competitive match, more than 480 players have made a league appearance for the club, of whom 90 players have made at least 100 appearances; those players are listed here.
Defender <a href="Krister%20Kristensson">Krister Kristensson</a> is the player with the most league appearances in the club's history, having made 348 appearances between 1963 and 1978, scoring seven goals. Kristensson also played for the <a href="Sweden%20national%20football%20team">Sweden national football team</a>, and ended his career with 38 international <a href="cap%20%28sport%29">caps</a>. Forward <a href="Hans%20H%C3%A5kansson">Hans Håkansson</a> is the player who has scored the most goals in league matches for Malmö FF, with 163 goals in 192 matches; <a href="Bo%20Larsson">Bo Larsson</a> holds the record of most goals scored in Allsvenskan with 119 goals in the league.
Players.
"Statistics correct as of match played 14 December 2019".
Club captains.
Since 1940, 30 players have held the position of club captain for Malmö FF. The first club captain was <a href="Sture%20M%C3%A5rtensson">Sture Mårtensson</a>, who was captain from 1940 to 1949. Mårtensson is also the longest-serving captain. <a href="Krister%20Kristensson">Krister Kristensson</a>, who was captain from 1970 to 1978, has the distinction of having won the most trophies as captain; he won five <a href="Allsvenskan">Allsvenskan</a> titles and four <a href="Svenska%20Cupen">Svenska Cupen</a> titles. The current club captain is midfielder <a href="Anders%20Christiansen">Anders Christiansen</a> who has held the captaincy since the beginning of the <a href="2020%20Malm%C3%B6%20FF%20season">2020 season</a>.
